Credit Card Statement
Your latest credit card statement is ready for viewing in the Citi Mobile® App.
View statement securely now (http://www.citibank.com.sg/MOB?ecid=ccestatement/)
Your Citi Credit Card statements are available at your fingertips.
Retrieve them seamlessly with the Citi Mobile® App whenever you need to.
You can also login to www.citibank.com.sg to view your electronic statements for the past 7 years.
Banking is made simple with Citi Mobile® App.
Login with your unique fingerprint or Face ID, simply & securely.
View your balance on-the-go, know what has been charged, real-time.
Secure your card. Lock your card instantly if it's misplaced, activate your card for overseas use when you need it.
See the rewards points you've accumulated on your Citi Credit Card at a glance.
Don't have online banking access yet? Download Citi Mobile® App. (https://www.citibank.com.sg/MOB) and activate your online access easily with your credit card number.
Click here (http://www.citibank.com.sg/gcb/otherservices/online-security-tips.htm?ecid=EMOWNSGCGAENGR09) for Online Security Tips.
Note
You will no longer receive paper statements for accounts which you are the principal account holder. If you have any queries or wish to provide account related instructions, please login to Citibank Online to send us a secure message via My Mailbox. Please do not respond to this email as all instructions or queries sent will not be acted upon or responded to.
If you wish to update your email address, login to www.citibank.com.sg (https://www.citibank.com.sg/) with your User ID and Password to select 'Services' > 'My Profile' > 'Update Contact Details'.

From: sm_cmpb_broadcast <cmpb_broadcast@defence.gov.sg> To: JIARONG.OCS@GMAIL.COM <JIARONG.OCS@GMAIL.COM> Subject: [CMPB] RENEWAL OF EXIT PERMIT Date: June 10, 2019 at 3:44:54 PM GMT+8
157K/1-1-13/3/RENEWAL/01062019-1067
Dear Mr Koh Jia Rong
You were issued with an Exit Permit IBH7321 which will expire on31 Jul 2019.
All NS-liable persons must possess a valid Exit Permit to remain outside Singapore. Offenders will be liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding S$10,000 or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or both.
As your Exit Permit will be expiring soon, please renew your Exit Permit online at www.ns.sg (http://www.ns.sg) if you wish to continue your overseas stay. Do note that you will require a SingPass 2-step verification (2FA) for this online application. For more information about SingPass 2FA, please refer to www.singpass.gov.sg (http://www.singpass.gov.sg). Otherwise, please return to Singapore by the expiry of your Exit Permit.
For further assistance, you may contact us via email or phone as stated below:
Email: contact@ns.sg (mailto:contact@ns.sg)
Phone: 1800-367-6767
+65 6567-6767 (from overseas)
Thank you.
Central Manpower Base
<<Message from Administrator>>: Please note that this is a no-reply email address. You may wish to email the NS Call Centre instead at contact@ns.sg (mailto:contact@ns.sg) for your query.
WARNING: "Privileged/Confidential information may be contained in this message. If you are not the intended addressee, you must not copy, distribute or take any action in reliance thereon. Communication of any information in this email to any unauthorised person is an offence under the Official Secrets Act (Cap 213). Please notify the sender immediately if you receive this in error."
cmpb_broadcast@defence.gov.sg

From: Udacity <support@udacity.com> To: Koh Jia Rong <jiarong.ocs@gmail.com> Subject: The classroom is now open for Cloud Computing programs! Date: June 12, 2019 at 1:58:24 AM GMT+8
I'm writing to announce you can now enroll and start learning in our new Cloud Computing programs. When you start either Nanodegree programs, you will immediately be immersed in hands-on quizzes, labs, and projects to give you the skills you need to have a successful career in these fields.
Hi Koh,
My name is Neha Garg and I lead our programs in the School of Cloud Computing at Udacity. I'm writing to announce the classroom is now open for our brand-new Cloud Computing Nanodegree programs. Make sure to enroll today to start learning alongside the inaugural class of students!
The world of Cloud Computing is growing at a tremendous pace, and cloud engineers are in high demand. As more and more consumer applications are built in the cloud, developers with experience in cloud technologies like AWS are highly valued by companies large and small.
In the Cloud Developer Nanodegree program (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/upw83giq?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=278a9167-a8fb-4e00-8314-1aa1d2c2e73d), you'll focus on building scalable full-stack applications on AWS, and will also learn how to refactor apps to microservices and how to use a serverless framework. In the Cloud DevOps Nanodegree program (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/b1ribjyv?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=278a9167-a8fb-4e00-8314-1aa1d2c2e73d), you'll focus on architecting and optimizing deployment pipelines, and how to deploy massive infrastructure securely.
When you start either Nanodegree programs, you will immediately be immersed in hands-on quizzes, labs, and projects to give you the skills you need to have a successful career in these fields. Plus, our 1-on-1 technical mentors and career services help you achieve your goals at every step of the way.
Enroll now (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/dvmzrqqm?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=278a9167-a8fb-4e00-8314-1aa1d2c2e73d) in the Cloud Developer or Cloud DevOps Nanodegree programs and start gaining the skills you need to excel!
Can’t wait to see you in the classroom!
Your Udacity Team
You received this email because you are signed up to receive email updates from Udacity. You can always opt out of all marketing emails (https://mclick.udacity.com/customer/unsubscribe?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=278a9167-a8fb-4e00-8314-1aa1d2c2e73d&eid=99846b6b-3380-7f71-3b3b-292200c1a210) or update your email preferences (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/jznfhvex?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=278a9167-a8fb-4e00-8314-1aa1d2c2e73d) to choose which emails you receive.

For those who would cave in to a Jones-style adventure, the 8 hour ride will be nothing. Kayak into one of the greatest river caves in the world, with a flourishing ecosystem and enormous stalagmites that look completely out of this world. (http://click.promotion.flyscoot.com/?qs=80fe9a45c4fba6e1a6c3f54c98e158b1c2eaa90bbbe30751610788bfd7db6930915be4737a99188e9b8d72fda979d871d0c6cf7b9c8bc786084b6d19ec416afd)
Nothing like a 2,500 year-old mystery to dial up on the mystique of Laos. Locals believe that these oversized stone pots were used to brew rice wine for the celebration of giants, while historians believe that they were used for ancient funeral processions. (http://click.promotion.flyscoot.com/?qs=80fe9a45c4fba6e155e02c190a72df4271522ccd86d0c026ed5d780a4c6d21638254c8412c5fbc1da7ab365da904967c3d51613998a74e884c7cbb0b2a4b9e28)

From: KrisFlyer <singaporeair@email.singaporeair.com> To: jiarong.ocs@gmail.com Subject: You can now convert your DBS Points to miles instantly via the KrisPay app! Date: June 12, 2019 at 1:18:02 PM GMT+8
You can now convert your DBS Points to miles instantly via the KrisPay app
view on a browser (https://t.email.singaporeair.com/r/?id=h60446cbf,25965736,259f2043&p1=%40xerwBn1pnq%2BwlWvntZs2kZRUrcbCrcsrEDRhGWOtx9Q%3D) membership no: 8803870496 (https://t.email.singaporeair.com/r/?id=h60446cbf,25965736,259f2044)
view on a browser (https://t.email.singaporeair.com/r/?id=h60446cbf,25965736,259f2045&p1=%40xerwBn1pnq%2BwlWvntZs2kZRUrcbCrcsrEDRhGWOtx9Q%3D) membership no: 8803870496 (https://t.email.singaporeair.com/r/?id=h60446cbf,25965736,259f2046)
Dear Mr Koh,
We are proud to partner DBS as our first rewards points conversion partner. You can now convert your DBS Points to miles instantly, anytime, anywhere, starting from as little as 100 DBS Points via the KrisPay app.
Simply tap on the DBS Rewards icon under the top up page in KrisPay and key in the amount of DBS Points you wish to convert to KrisPay miles*, after you log in to your DBS account.
The KrisPay miles converted can then be transferred to your KrisFlyer account^ (1 KrisPay mile = 1 KrisFlyer mile) or you can choose to keep them in your KrisPay wallet for future purchases.
Yes, you heard us right. The transfer of reward points to miles will be instantaneous, so you no longer have to wait for your reward points to be transferred to your KrisFlyer account.
*100 DBS Points = 170 KrisPay miles There is no transaction fee for converting DBS Points to miles via the KrisPay app
^KrisPay miles converted from partner reward points must be transferred in full per transaction to your KrisFlyer account within 7 days of accrual
Yours Sincerely,
Renee Chong
Manager Loyalty Marketing
It is easy to convert your DBS Points to miles:
More reward partners will be added progressively to offer you more ways to top up your KrisPay wallet.
Do make sure that your KrisPay app is updated via App Store or Google Play to the latest version to use this feature.
Meet Our New KrisPay Partners

From: LUCERNE FESTIVAL <kontakt@lucernefestival.ch> To: jiarong.ocs@gmail.com Subject: Die russische Musik beim Sommer-Festival Date: June 7, 2019 at 11:47:17 PM GMT+8
Please click on this link (https://www.lucernefestival.ch/en/newsletter/newsletter/506/hm4l3v7tl8/) if the e-mail is not displaying properly.
7. June 2019
Russian Music and the great conductors and soloists of Russia at LUCERNE FESTIVAL
The LUCERNE FESTIVAL ORCHESTRA (#1852-nl-content)
Kirill Petrenko and Patricia Kopatchinskaja (#1853-nl-content)
Tugan Sokhiev conducts Tschaikowsky (#1851-nl-content)
The Orchestra of the LUCERNE FESTIVAL ALUMNI performs Mossolow (#1862-nl-content)
Evgeny Kissin – Russians exceptional pianist (#1854-nl-content)
The London Symphony Orchestra performs Rachmaninoff (#1863-nl-content)
Dear Mr. Koh
Great composers in Russia have long reflected on the whims of power. Especially memorable examples include such works as Tchaikovsky's later symphonies, which allude to the power of Fate itself, and Dmitri Shostakovich's 10th Symphony, in which he comes to terms with the dictator Stalin.
Enjoy the great conductors, soloists, and composers from Russia as LUCERNE FESTIVAL explores the theme of “Power” — and get inspired by the pain, hope, and longing expressed by the Russian spirit.
You can buy tickets at www.lucernefestival.ch (https://www.lucernefestival.ch/newsletter/link/hm4l3v7tl8/azy74td8/), by writing to ticketbox@lucernefestival.ch (mailto:ticketbox@lucernefestival.ch), or by calling +41 41 226 44 80 (Mon-Fri 9 am to 12 pm and 1.30 pm to 5 pm — Lucerne time).
Here are some special concert tips:

From: TechCrunch <noreply@techcrunch.com> To: jiarong.ocs@gmail.com Subject: Prices increase next friday on Disrupt SF passes Date: June 14, 2019 at 12:28:04 AM GMT+8
The countdown has begun tagline
Super Early Bird savings expire next week
The super early-bird season for serious savings on passes to Disrupt SF 2019 (October 2-4) (http://mkto-ab120143.com/URzq0gY08R0W8I01er000KT) comes to an end next week. Right now, you can save up to $1,800, but that deep discount disappears on June 21 at 11:59 p.m. (PT). Don’t miss your chance to attend TechCrunch’s flagship Disrupt (http://mkto-ab120143.com/URzq0gY08R0W8I01er000KT) event at the lowest possible price.
Here’s even more budget-friendly news. Choose the payment plan option during checkout, andlock in these super-low prices (http://mkto-ab120143.com/URzq0gY08R0W8I01er000KT) while spreading your payments over time for even more bottom-line relief.
If you're on the fence, maybe you haven't heard about the high profile speakers who will be at Disrupt SF (http://mkto-ab120143.com/URzq0gY08R0W8I01er000KT) like David Krane (http://mkto-ab120143.com/h8qeLgR00W000R8Ir010YAT) from GV (Google Ventures), Sam Altman (http://mkto-ab120143.com/TBrWI0q0e000TRM108gR8Y0) from Open AI, Evan Spiegel (http://mkto-ab120143.com/wRTYrg8W80000qeC00R1N0I) from Snapchat, Jeanette Manfra (http://mkto-ab120143.com/lIRRD0008eTq0Y18g0r0O0W) from Homeland Security's Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency and many more (http://mkto-ab120143.com/n0Wq0PE01Rr80YR0Te008Ig)!
There’s so much to be experienced at Disrupt SF (http://mkto-ab120143.com/URzq0gY08R0W8I01er000KT) — Startup Battlefield (http://mkto-ab120143.com/WW0eFrRg80Q1Y8q00R0TI00), the Disrupt SF Hackathon (http://mkto-ab120143.com/Q0IY0TR0WR18R0re800Ggq0), interactive workshops, Startup Alley (http://mkto-ab120143.com/VTRH0008Ie0Y100W8gRqSr0), Q&A sessions, unparalleled networking with CrunchMatch (http://mkto-ab120143.com/t8Yq1R0IWT08I00rRg000eT) and more.
And you can go for the lowest possible price (http://mkto-ab120143.com/URzq0gY08R0W8I01er000KT) and the highest possible value — if you beat the deadline: June 21 at 11:59 p.m. (PT). Procrastination is not your friend. Be a super early-bird and save up to $1,800 — get your pass today (http://mkto-ab120143.com/URzq0gY08R0W8I01er000KT). Catalyst Conference Jun 19-20 (http://mkto-ab120143.com/er0TUY01000RWI0RgeJ8q08) Come for the startup competition, stay for the keynotes at the Catalyst Conference on June 19-20 in SF. Get advice from partners at Sequoia, Khosla, Canaan, Salesforce and more. Get 15% off with TECHRUNCH15. Read more (http://mkto-ab120143.com/er0TUY01000RWI0RgeJ8q08)
Sponsored by:
Is your company interested in sponsoring or exhibiting at Disrupt SF? Click here (http://mkto-ab120143.com/m000rL10g0R8e8qTRIW0WY0).
Have questions? Contact us at events@techcrunch.com (http://mkto-ab120143.com/AI0M0gWR10r8eqR0080X0TY)
Add event to calendar (http://mkto-ab120143.com/HW0010R0rqNTIYg08eR00Y8)

From: AngelList Weekly <newsletters@angel.co> To: jiarong.ocs@gmail.com Subject: The startups fighting cancer Date: June 14, 2019 at 2:31:18 AM GMT+8
Plus: How Kimberly Bryant started Black Girls CODE with her 401(k)
View Online (https://sg-mktg.-expGtIMXQGA7w9HJbJdaRe)
Cancer sucks, but there are some exciting developments on the research front. In the last month alone, we’ve seen regulators consider a CRISPR therapy that directly targets tumor cells (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h1/DFruV08mvN0MyCCrHm-2ByQMQ5CifknFfEziLKVf09YjVvnvMgwarkNSg09C5-2BKMYuI-2B458hUOa33-2F2LSeXjjiKWNz79hmgK1QxfFT-2FIEtBuk-3D)—a first for the U.S.—as well as a laser thatzaps tumor cells (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h2/1cYo-2Fxo45HcEj-2BHb2kZ3s15E8ANBaYIROw-2BvY2yIRnUwQ-2B-2BxsNmovSoUjKYSFKQvi3PYtRTmJiu-2Bl4kYdRfNuqriGwMJj8Q0sHnWR79trUe8zf5o4mmYfXfLCRJPSJQBUBBDAltjbv4fZTd5wGcONeCMl8m-2BHITNvVlK525ZlyM-3D) from patients bloodstreams without damaging healthy tissues.
And it’s not just the research around new cancer therapies that's exciting. There’s a host of startups attempting to tackle other parts of the cancer treatment puzzle, from diagnostics, to emotional support, to medical record logistics.
In the world of diagnostics and early detection, we have startups like: Freenome (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h3/pc8HsrSSu9up-2F7Wb0LLVBYhjcTfnQduUsdTnU-2BOpybhcAdf69cEGROZgxAEazNfp), backed by a16z, using unique blood tests and AI to detect early signs of cancer. Ezra (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h4/vesEoXnENqE0DxXQsZBt8l8kFf-2BQgtz34XdEZmk7kbePlsANjXHDKIk1CsLrqyQ-2BOo4EZx83h0cfiHI-2BABp0Jw-3D-3D), using full-body MRIs and machine learning to detect 11 kinds of cancer in men and 13 in women.
On the logistical side of treatment, there are startups like: Flatiron Health (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h5/pc8HsrSSu9up-2F7Wb0LLVBQt9yut-2BejC4Vod4nZnoeIan4trppesVD3QgFBQ5hOjj), a collaborative platform for doctors, academics, regulators, and more. Embleema (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h6/pc8HsrSSu9up-2F7Wb0LLVBcDZV5skXAszj8Mnwi52ynzd6dpNVKZr0bnWsfItzv-2BF), a blockchain company for patient health data, which has partnered with Europe’s leading cancer center (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h7/B-2BkaOajjYskp6-2BP4tN3nRaYemwktYf3VT-2FbVARXi-2Bq1YpUq4HP3y24iTkADPL1p075NheCUn6GNq7yJTk3fABLczBxPBv9UToGGVUIsVaydcqqO-2B0DsIDp9JmofpcyLqdnpfqS0bFOb3I90efkHpTz-2BZBvyMrAhxPc7GHhWyF-2Fc-3D).
And then there are other cancer-focused startups that are tougher to categorize, like Belong.life (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h8/dTwK-2FKQqcQuahAmi7hZpQUfEoZaqNjdQ0eTRTJg5wz8-3D). A platform for cancer patients, it offers a social network where users can connect with other patients, explore a clinical trial matching service, leverage oncologist-staffed support chat, and use a file storage system for medical records.
The number of people diagnosed with cancer makes the potential for impact huge, while the difficulty of the market's core problems makes the barrier to entry for companies high. For a startup looking to innovate and affect as many individuals as possible, there might not be a more exciting space. If you’re interested in joining such a startup, search AngelList here (https://u13051.ct.sendgrid.net/mpss/c/JAE/-zI/t.2sf/6_AuwEl8SAWrFMwws-jYzg/h9/pc8HsrSSu9up-2F7Wb0LLVBcNeyKtO3x5wGnLBQ3s-2FHWIQiYlx13JoQBCMmiIjL3iebC5GZij7o0yOMgEPX-2BRmJyW5QagymMQ6-2FRZw4Q62KxDgt8C8dYY-2BQpCiCYgkVkpQSPc2o0X1PDNI5DCBHnWernJ31hWSsVGOpNXs4Cqx-2F3W3blZEt7x6dWFtJLrQsODkjFa0mNW8Rg-2FQC-2B5pd0UXebbX52T9FKUqPatGseT10iOUqEvlS-2FVWNwtKMBapXHQSSC5ZLKdsb-2Fc-2FjSQSc5zkog-3D-3D).
How Kimberly Bryant started Black Girls CODE with her 401(k)—and taught 14,000 Girls
1,000,000.
That’s how many young women Kimberly Bryant, founder of Black Girls CODE, wants to train in computer science by 2040. For context, there were fewer than 5,000 black women enrolled in U.S. computer science programs in 2015-2016.
If you haven’t heard of it, Black Girls CODE is an organization founded in 2011 that provides computer science workshops, after-school programs, and classes to girls in underprivileged communities around the world. Over the last eight years, they’ve taught over 14,000 girls across America and in their international base in Johannesburg.
While Black Girls CODE is a brand well-recognized for its impact, the story of how it got where it is today is less well-known. We chatted with Kimberly Bryant, its founder and CEO, about the ways the organization has grown, how it’s impacted thousands of girls, and what she’d like to see companies do better when recruiting.

Developed with Tencent, this new free course is designed to teach developers around the world how to create their own mini programs on WeChat.
Hi Koh,
We’re excited to announce the launch of our new free course: WeChat Mini Program Development (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/6gbtj90c?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=af6c57e0-779b-4561-9bee-44cb5e8ce5ce)!
Built by Tencent and Udacity, this new free course is designed to teach developers around the world how to create their own mini programs on WeChat, the most popular messaging app in China and with a growing number of users around the globe.
Developed by Tencent in 2011, WeChat is a multi-function mobile communications application. Among WeChat’s most disruptive capabilities are its “WeChat mini programs,” sub-applications within the WeChat ecosystem. With more than one billion active monthly users worldwide, WeChat’s importance is almost impossible to overestimate.
With companies like McDonald’s, Nike, Tesla and Google releasing mini programs, the opportunity and demand for WeChat Mini Program Developers is incredible.
START FREE COURSE (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/6gbtj90c?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=af6c57e0-779b-4561-9bee-44cb5e8ce5ce)
In the WeChat Mini Program free course, you’ll learn to become a professional mini program developer in 4 weeks.
In the free course, you’ll:
Get familiar with WeChat mini program developer tools. Build interactive user interfaces on a mini program. Make queries and parse data to access location and time stamp, etc.
Start the free course today (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/6gbtj90c?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=af6c57e0-779b-4561-9bee-44cb5e8ce5ce) to begin your journey to becoming a WeChat Mini Program expert.

Join our webinars and career events to learn how you can join the Cloud community!
Join our upcoming Cloud Computing events
Cloud computing is a rapidly growing and in-demand field. Join us over the next several weeks as we present webinars, career tips, and interviews so you can learn more about this exciting field.
June 10
Evolution of the Cloud: from IaaS to Serverless (https://mclick.udacity.com/z/ltit7rca?uid=16bebce7-cf83-4f81-8e5a-dc6be9c90d90&mid=df76db80-d499-41d0-987e-57398a5b81bd)

In this workshop, we'll practice the initial introductory question that leads most all interviews: "Tell me about yourself". Your response to this fundamental question can make or break the interview. Creating and practicing an impactful response to this question builds your confidence and projects the image you want interviewers to see in you.

From: GateHub <noreply@gatehub.net> To: jiarong.ocs@gmail.com Subject: Malicious email warning / FAKE WALLETS Date: June 16, 2019 at 12:52:26 AM GMT+8
Dear GateHub Customer,
Our users are being targeted with phishing emails from addresses registered @gatehub.com, @gatehub.net or similar.
Phishing emails look like they have been sent by GateHub, however, they were in fact sent by the attacker. The emails are malicious and did not come from GateHub.
GateHub will never send sensitive information such as ripple secret keys over email. If you cannot verify the origin of the received email, please refer to the customer correspondence timeline (http://email.gatehub.net/c/eJxNjkEOhCAUQ0-jO8kHBHXBwkz0Hvj5jkwUDOD9h9lN0rRNF81zBjc1iH1qvRHAJ9Bcca2E0Iyz6TUsCwDMy7iuch2aHt620PFsLFBpD8MVkLV2HF2_u54kDCiUxs0JuU9oeXuao5Q7N3JuxFqVn_uOqbC_m7oeWI1C9-SaNhWPJ_2q1ACi1xWGy-715BIvSh3GlCjfMTgKSF3xF50-UJvMx9sUw5tFzD_Uy_qTYby-ivxHEg) posted on our support page.
The subject line of phishing emails might be similar to the subject line below: Critical Security Warning / Action Required - New Secured Wallets
Emails instruct users to move their funds to a new hosted wallet created by GateHub. This is, in fact, a ripple wallet created by the attacker and IT IS NOT SAFE!
Do not transfer any funds to the address provided in this email or other similar emails.
Example of emails:
Sent from @gatehub.net:
IMPORTANT: be aware of the warning banner showing that the email was not verified by GateHub Limited.
Sent from @gatehub.com:
GateHub WILL NEVER create new ripple wallets on behalf of any user.
We kindly ask our customers to forward any suspicious email to security@gatehub.net (mailto:security@gatehub.net)
What you should do
Ignore the instructions in the email. Forward the emails to security@gatehub.net (mailto:security@gatehub.net). Mark *@gatehub.com as spam in your email inbox.
We strongly advise against saving your sensitive information in your email or any other online storage.
To alert all our customers of potential phishing emails we added a warning notification to our wallet's home page.
For any additional questions, please contact us through our customer support service, here (http://email.gatehub.net/c/eJxNjbsOhCAUBb9GuiUXUIGCwhj5Dx53xY2KEfz_ZbtNTqaYYk40wQ-SvzXZDAemYWQDGwfOR8qonuWyAMC0KGuFlV0Pq6uYHk9PrCQZD0EIQKWxx-iUligYa5nIfFDRI9lNqvUqnZg6btvKc135rvQv02wKDXi-nkJu89ncnc-V5lB-f4fbdhry8QWgIDLl).
Sincerely, GateHub Team
© GateHub Ltd.
noreply@gatehub.net
